comment._content: There is definitely a rope in the next picture.  If you look at the larger version of it you can see someone's hand resting on it.  Perhaps the line here really is a rope.

comment.author: 37401346@N00
comment._content:
The man holding the flag is Giles Coons, my Great Great Grandfather John Rockwell's 
(pictured behind him to the right in the white shirt) wife's brother. This is the 106th.

comment.author: 95219136@N02
comment._content: Wes is correct, whoever scratched the 12th is wrong, the 12th while at Gettysburg were in the 5th Army Corps which is a Maltese Cross Corps Badge, not the 2nd Corps Badge (Clover) shown on that flag. Also The only unit to be designated as the 12th PA that in Gettysburg, was the 12th PA Reserves which was also known as the 41st Pennsylvania Volunteer Infantry. The Philadelphia Brigade which was made up as the 69th, 71st, 72nd and the 106th Pennsylvania Volunteer Infantry's was in the 2nd Corps. Hopefully the LOC will do some research and fix their error.
